text.0: i balm with oil the mighty rakṣasslayer to the most famous friend i come for shelter.
text.1: enkindled sharpened by our rites may agni protect us in the day and night from evil.
text.2: o jātavedas with the teeth of iron enkindled with thy flame attack the demons.
text.3: seize with thy longue the foolish gods adorers rend put within thy mouth the rawflesh caters.
text.4: apply thy teeth the upper and the lower thou who hast both enkindled and destroying.
text.5: roam also in the air o king around us and with thy jaws assail the wicked spirits.
text.6: bending thy shafts through sacrifices agni whetting their points with song as if with whetstones.
text.7: pierce to the heart therewith the yātudhānas and break their arms uplifed to attack thee.
text.8: pierce through the yātudhānas skin o agni let the destroying dart with fire consume him.
text.9: rend his joints jātavedas let the cater of flesh fleshseeking track his mangled body.
text.10: where now thou seest agni jātavedas one of these demons standing still or roaming.
text.11: or flying on those paths in airs midregion sharpen the shaft and as an archer pierce him.
text.12: tear from the evil spirit jātavedas what he hath seized and with his spears hath captured.
text.13: blazing before him strike him down o agni let spotted carrioneating kites devour him.
text.14: here tell this forth o agni whosoever is he himself or acteth as a demon.
text.15: him grasp o thou most youthful with thy fuel to the matiseers eye give him as booty.
text.16: with keen glance guard the sacrifice o agni thou sage conduct it onward to the vasus.
text.17: let not the fiends o manbeholder harm thee burning against the rākṣasas to slay them.
text.18: look on the fiend mid men as manbeholder rend thou his three extremities in pieces.
text.19: demolish with thy flame his ribs o agni the yātudhānas root destroy thou triply.
text.20: thrice agni let thy noose surround the demon who with his falsehood injures holy order.
text.21: loud roaring with thy flame o jātavedas crush him and cast him down before the singer.
text.22: lead thou the worshipper that eye o agni wherewith thou lookest on the hoofarmed demon.
text.23: with light celestial in atharvans manner burn up the foot who ruins truth with falsehood.
text.24: agni what curse the pair this day have uttered what heated word the worshippers have spoken.
text.25: each arrowy taunt sped from the angry spiritpierce to the heart therewith the yātudhānas.
text.26: with fervent heat exterminate the demons destroy the fiends with burning flame o agni.
text.27: destroy with fire the foolish gods adorers blaze and destrepy the insatiable monsters.
text.28: may gods destroy this day the evildoer may each hot curse of his return and blast him.
text.29: let arrows pierce the liar in his vitals and visvas net enclose the yātudhāna.
text.30: the fiend who smears himself with flesh of cattle with flesh of horses and of human bodies.
text.31: who steals the milchcows milk away o agnitear off the heads of such with fiery fury.
text.32: the cow gives milk each year o manregarder let not the yātudhāna ever taste it.
text.33: if one would glut him with the biesting agni pierce with thy flame his vitals as he meets thee.
text.34: let the fiends drink the poison of the cattle may aditi cast off the evildoers.
text.35: may the god savitar give them up to ruin and be their share of plants and herbs denied them.
text.36: agni from days of old thou slayest demons never shall rākṣasas in fight oercome thee.
text.37: burn up the foolish ones the fleshdevourers let none of them escape thine heavenly arrow.
text.38: guard us o agni from above and under protect us flom behind us and before us.
text.39: and may thy flames most fierce and never wasting glowing with fervent heat consume the sinner.
text.40: from rear from front from under from above us o king protect us as a sage with wisdom.
text.41: guard to old age thy friend o friend eternal o agni as immortal guard us mortals.
text.42: we set thee round us as a fort victorious agni thee a sage.
text.43: of hero lineage day by day destroyer of our treacherous foes.
text.44: burn with thy poison turned against the treacherous brood of rākṣasas.
text.45: o agni with thy sharpened glow with lances armed with points of flame.
text.46: burn thou the paired kimīdins brun agni the yātudhāna pairs.
text.47: i sharpen thee infallible with hymns o sage be vigilant.
text.48: shoot forth o agni with thy flame demolish them on every side.
text.49: break thou the yātudhānas strength the vigour of the rākṣasa.
